text: The sandwiches here are really good and the couple who owns it are some of the sweetest people you will ever meet. If you want an awesome sandwich while also supporting a local business then I suggest coming here!

This sandwich shop is next to DePaul and has a very retro feel to it. Students come here all the time.  The decor and the staff are the stars of this restaurants. I didn't think I'd find something like this in Chicago. The atmosphere was so friendly and calming. The staff was by far the friendliest restaurant waitress I've met and she was really nice and polite to everyone.  We went in around 6pm for dinner, no wait. We ordered a Italian beef sandwich and a Italian beef and sausage combo sandwich. The Italian beef tasted old, like it was cooked in the morning old. It was also overly watery such that it soaked up the bread and caused it to fall apart. The Italian beef with sausage was significantly better, according to my brother, as he thoroughly enjoyed his meal.  The staff and decor are good, but the food quality is not worth a 4.5 star on yelp.

I could wax poetic about the food at this place. The grilled chicken gyro is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had, and it's a staple in my diet now. But, as other reviewers have mentioned, the woman who runs the place is the star of the show and makes Branko's what it is - which is truly awesome all around. 10 years ago, I stopped in for a sandy and didn't realize it was cash only. With a kind smile, she said she knew I was good for it, and to get her next time. A few days later, I popped in and paid my tab. I moved away shortly after and just recently moved back right next door to Branko's. My family now eats there weekly. Never mind the guy who said everything is fried - their grilled chicken is to die for and incredibly healthy. Branko's is a very rare gem. I can't recommend it enough.

I'm in love with this place and this family. As great as the food was, the wonderful woman who runs it stole the show. She couldn't have been friendlier and I'm from the South which is famous for hospitality. I can't wait to come back here. Best service around and the food was exactly what we were looking for. We had a chili dog and fries. Simple and delicious.
Place is awesome. Retro in a way that makes me think of being a kid in a sand which shop. Got a Italian, was super huge. Lady working super nice also. Will be back for more
I ordered and Italian sandwich, char polish and cheese fries. The quality of the food is poor and taste is horrible.

This is not a health food store.  I try not to come here unless I'm hungover.  It's all fried.  And it's not really high on atmosphere.  Ok that said, the woman who runs this place is the nicest, most awesome person in the world.  Her awesomeness and sincere niceness makes me feel less guilty about eating grease.  Great place for a quick greasy fix.  And hey, they make their own veggie burgers from scratch!  Yum.

I was in the mood for a brat and a co-worker suggested this shop.  I wasn't sure what to expect since sometimes I gauge a place by how busy it looks but I'll definitely  The food is not what makes this shop a 5 star, though there is nothing wrong with it. In fact it is tasty, reasonably priced and good portions,  What makes this place special is most definitely the service and the personality of the owners.  Such a kind lady, was smiling throughout and seems very content.  She is very attentive and really wants you to enjoy the food she makes for you.  I was even instructed on which way was up on my to go bag so that it wouldn't get all over me when I opened it but so that it would look good because "you also eat with your eyes".  So funny, I've been in upscale eateries thought to have "good service" that didn't put as much into their whole body as this woman does on her own.  If you've read other, reviews you'll see that their service is ALWAYS mentioned, and make sure to bring cash.

I went here today after graduating from DePaul many years ago. I have many fond memories of this place from those days. The same sweet lady is there serving all the customers, it still has the same solid Chicago style food, and I still enjoyed it after all this time. Branko's is a family owned and operated joint - the same family since it opened back in the day. The food hits the spot and it's not expensive. I had a great chat with the lady. I wish her and her family all the best!

When I walk into Branko's, it feels like I've walked back in time - it's a very old school sandwich shop.  The food is pretty basic, and I don't feel that it's exceptional in terms of taste, fairly typical hot dogs, cheeseburgers, gyros, chicken sandwiches, etc.  The real stand-out is the people who run it.  I genuinely feel appreciated as a customer, and I think because they care about their business, they take great pride into putting together the food.  They make a very tasty grilled chicken sandwich that's probably one of the healthier things on the menu.  The patty is thin, but you get an oversized piece of meat served in a soft kaiser bun.  It is simply dressed with lettuce, tomato and mayo, but the nice charred flavor really makes it.  Being cash only can be a little convenient, but I noticed that you can now order online with a credit card.

Can't say anything but good things. Every visits here great! If you're a student at DePaul this is great to stop by for lunch. You must try it! The service by itself is beyond good. I am always greeted upon entrance and helped with the menu if needed. Id definitely recommend the gyros, chicken sandwich and mozzarella sticks. Just bring cash ! You won't regret it.
Amazing service, be sure you will be called "honey" or sweetheart". Feels like home at Branko's.
I haven't been here since the 80s but it is still as wonderful as it was back then. Great family owned business that has great food and service. Best Italian Beef in town.

Branko's is out of a dream. It is cash only, which I didn't realize until I ordered. Mama (the woman taking my order) offered to cover me until I came back next time. Then someone sitting down eating a sandwich paid for our sandwiches. It was also one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. THE best customer service.  The decor is very 50's mom and pop restaurant and it works really well with the feel of the place.  Highly recommend Branko's

This place is outstanding and reliable.  Mama makes the sandwiches and she always makes sure your order is exactly how you want it.  I've been living here for almost a year and whenever I need a quick sandwich I take the walk over and have a great experience.  Try the turkey sandwich on toasted wheat bread.

BEST VEGGIE BURGER IN LINCOLN PARK! It's a housemade patty without any fillers and tastes perfect. The chef has crafted a really unique and delicious recipe, that you have to try to fully appreciate. If that wasn't enough, because it is a sandwich shop, they can customize it with any toppings you want (even those not typically found on a burger). Family owned, and the owner is one of the kindest people you will meet. Order is always ready quickly, and so many options if you want to bring your friends.  This place is the definition of a great, and one of the best sandwich shops in Chicago.

I cannot say enough good things about this place. The service is incredible, due to the wonderful staff. It is family owned and operated and they are (especially the woman behind the counter!) literally the nicest people you will ever meet. This is a great "hole in the wall" kind of place, a little hidden Lincoln Park gem.      I come here with my sister all the time, and we have NEVER had a bad experience. I mean this incredibly genuinely. If there is a problem with anything, you can always talk to the lady at the counter and she will work it out for you. She remembers little things about everyone's order (for example, they always remember that my sister loves her side of hot peppers) Literally the most spot on costumer service you can ask for. I would give them 6 stars just for the way they treat their costumers.        It's good to keep in mind that it is cash only (there is, however, an ATM at the car wash right next door- note that there is a fee, for those  planning on using). Another note is that some things tend to get pricey (not extremely, but perhaps a good thing to keep in mind for students) so just mind the menu and add ons. But there are plenty of affordable options and combos!    Some good menu items to try are the cheeseburger (great w everything), Chicago style hotdog, chili cheese fries or the grilled chicken sandwich. They also make AMAZING gyros! Today I had a Greek Salad with Gyros which was loaded pretty nicely with meat cooked to perfection.      Hands down, one of the best places to eat in the area. If you're looking for diner style food that's made with high quality and care, look no further. I think you will find it quite difficult to not completely fall in love with this little sandwich shop!
DePaul is privileged to have such an amazing place on-campus. The food is great, the atmosphere is perfect, and the family that runs it is to die for.  Just bring cash!
Too nice for words! Great Gyro! If your in the DePaul area don't miss out:) you won't be sorry!!

The woman who served us was very nice. Food seemed a bit expensive for the place, and we're still not really sure how it added up. $32 for 3 people, none of us even got drinks. A nice shop if you want to get in and out with a sandwich.
Probably the BEST tuna salad sandwich I've ever had. They were the nicest and quick with my order.
The gyro and burger are always great! The family that runs the place are the best.  Always make you feel at home. Great family owned joint. Can't say enough good things about this place.
Great, authentic sub stop. The Italian sub is loaded with meat - be careful their hot giardinera is really hot!! The Italian beef sandwich is very good.  Grab & go!

I've passed this place 100 times as a DePaul student without ever stopping in, probably because I never have cash on me (Tip: There's an atm next door at the gas station). I'm happy I finally made it in because the food is so good.  The owner was possibly the nicest lady in the world.  Low key, I'm happy I did wait to come in here because it could easily become my go-to spot and make that freshman 15 even worse.

To off the review I'll let your know that looks on the outside of this place are so decieving. While the outside is a standard look for a resturant the food and service here is top notch. The sweet woman taking your order and making the food opens up her compassion and it shows in everything she does.  I went here to get some lunch on my hour downtime between classes and had decided to try multiple different items to get a real feel for this place. This place is a greasy spoon resturant that has plenty of different options. I ordered a Italian Sausage, Bacon Grilled Cheese and Grilled Chicken Sandwich. All of them were really good. I would definately recommend giving this place a try.

IF YOU GO TO DEPAUL EAT HERE INSTEAD OF FRIGGIN WHOLE FOODS. This place is amazing and the woman who owns it has been in Lincoln Park forever. I had a gyro, I basically fell into it because it was so large and delicious and garlicky and perfect. I get it whole foods had salad so you can feel better about yourself but lets be honest, we're all getting two slices for $6 so just do yourself a favour and get something better for yourself and for the neighbourhood $6 at Branko's.

Branko's is wonderful!! We happened In here and will definitely be back! Not only was the food delicious, but the lady behind the counter was the most friendliest, nicest, most helpful person.  She happily offered to make anything on the menu any way we wanted it. Got us an extra chair from the back room, and said if we needed anything at all just let her know. It's really fantastic to go to a place and feel appreciated as a customer. Keep up the great work Branko's!!!

When we asked the woman behind the counter, "what's better, the gyro or the hot dog?" she replied, "It's all good or I don't put it on the menu!" The gyro was excellent. Grits and chicken soup flavorful. This is a Formica table order at the counter kinda place. Lunch for two was $15 and super quick.

I LOVE BRANKOS, the owners are so nice and part of the fabric in this neighborhood.  I always leave with a little more food than i thought. And even though she didnt have cash once, she let me come back to pay her the next day.  Seriously some of the nicest people around.

Absolutely one of Chicago's best kept secrets! Brankos was my go to for a delicious breakfast, lunch, or dinner during my years as a student at DePaul, and continues to be my favorite spot for a great lunch, as I now work at DePaul. Andja is absolutely fantastic and not only cares for her customers like her own family, but is one heck of a great chef! You literally can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and it's all freshly made right there in the restaurant. Speaking of Family, you'll still see Branko (the restaurant namesake) and his wife working the counter from time to time, in addition to other members of the family. I would give more than 5 stars if I could!

Came in here for a quick sandwich and a little free wifi. The gyro was delicious and the service was impeccable. As close as you can get to a meal at home with your mom asking what else she can get for you. Come for the food. Stay for the hospitality.

One of the most homely places I have ever been. The owner gave me a soup to take home because I wasn't feeling too well. And it's so easy to customize my order according to how I like it. The food is decent and reasonably priced too. A nice neighbourhood joint!

The food is excellent, all fresh and homemade  Had honestly the best gyro I have ever eaten. Highly recommend that choice. The chicken tenders are also a great choice. Freshly made and delicious. But even more, it is a family run restaurant that makes you feel like you are part of the family. Andja, the manager, is the warmest, kindest mother who treats all her customers like family. They only accept cash, but their policy is no one leaves hungry. A truly kind and trusting policy that is emblematic of the establishment's essence. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Simple, comforting, and amazing menu.  Got the sausage, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich on a roll for only $5, and it's one of the best I've ever had!!! The sausage is fresh, REAL sausage, and the egg is freshly made too. So impressed!

Branko's has delicious sandwiches, and the owners of the place are lovely. I was craving grilled cheese, so I went in and was treated like family. Will definitely go back next time I'm in the neighborhood.

Branko's is a greasy spoon sandwich shop. A family-owned, been-there-for-40-years greasy spoon sandwich shop that doesn't look like they've changed a bit since it opened. They won't dazzle you with trendy ingredients, aesthetics, or even a credit card swiper, but it'll give you a full belly for a fair price.  I had a Ruben which wasn't bad, but definitely pales in comparison to any place that specializes in corned beef. It was so no frills that they served it with a bottle of thousand island dressing that I'm pretty sure was Aldi brand. Upset I was not cause altogether it was under ten bucks.  The best part is they have a really nice family feel since the owner is behind the counter slinging the sandwiches herself. For this reason I can rally behind Branko's, but I wouldn't call it my favorite for the food.
The boss was so nice, I do not know it is cash only after I took the order. She was so nice and said I can pay her back whenever I have cash! Her words warmed my heart! And it made my day!
Terrific Italian beef sandwich today ..... And Ms Branko provided great service.  Super friendly and welcoming.  We will be back.
Great place to grab really fresh food. Also, it has the best customer service I have ever experienced anywhere! I always get the cold cut sandwich and it fills me up
Great, cheap food and you also get great service. I was short a few dollars and the owner told me to come back whenever I could to pay her back. It's a great place to eat.

Came here while visiting Depaul. The place doesn't do much for me aesthetically, but who cares! My daughter and I both ordered a burger and we got cheese fries. I don't suggest you get the cheese fries. I think they just put regular cheese on the fries and put them in the microwave.... not sure. The burger was good though. The lady that works here is about the sweetest thing I have ever seen. She is so nice. Her son was working with her too. I wish she was my mom. Just saying. She was friggin adorbs and nice. I'd come back just to support her family business. Keep up the good work!

Stopped by for some lunch with my dad expecting some average burger joint fare only to be pleasantly surprised. The staff were very kind and genuine and the food, an Italian beef with giardiniera, peppers, and a side of fries, was one of the best I've ever had. If you get the fries, toss some seasoned salt on it. It's stellar.
The woman who works here is so nice - and the food is so good and cheap perfect for college students especially depual students because its right across the street from the quad

I've been eating at Branko's for the past two years and can't even think of what to write to properly praise it. Angela is an angel and will treat you like family. She works every single day 8 am-8 pm besides Sundays, only takes one holiday per year (I think it's Christmas) and runs the shop almost completely alone. It's a family run business and you will frequently see her adorable mother and father taking orders, watching TV, or cleaning up the restaurant. Nowhere in Chicago feels more like home to me -- I am so thankful for Branko's! Try the double cheeseburger with grilled onions. Amazing.

The family, especially the lady at the front of the register is the nicest woman I've ever met. I walked in once and didn't realize they were cash only, when I realized that I started to leave. The woman said she'd never allowed a child to leave her restaurant hungry. Since that day, I have and will continue to go to her restaurant. The food is your typical fast food. However she has some extraordinary dishes. Hers soups and chili is delicious and her chicken sandwich is grilled to perfection. She doesn't put salt on her fries, but leaves all kinds of seasonings out for those who would. It's hard to find someone who not only gives a shit about their restaurant but also about their customers and community. I will forever have a special place in my heart for them.

If you want to talk about excellent customer service. I ordered my food and as I handed the lady my card, she told me no credit cards cash only. Well I have just spent my last bit of cash. Before I could even ask where the closest ATM is she says " I make it you pay me later".    She knows I'm a student and decided to let me order WITH OUT PAYING! She asked if I would be back soon and to pay her when I'm back.  Because of this I will always come back.
The absolute best people that are left in this world. The service is beyond amazing, it's something that just isn't around. It will be an absolute positive in you day if you decide to stop in.
Warm service, great food, great selection, well priced.  Lovely experience!

I really wanted to love this place. The woman at the counter was very sweet and she threw in two free mozzarella sticks with my fries. Service was quick and easy. Unfortunately the food was just so so. The hot dog was good (can't really go wrong if you use Vienna beef) but had too many pickles (in addition to relish...). The fries and mozzarella sticks had zero salt and thus were tasteless.  FYI- Cash only!

Very kind people. Very respectful. Clean place with bathroom services. Cute little place with an old styl3 decor. I highly recommend this place to anyone. Food was really good as well. Coffee was good as well. A must go to in Lincoln Park!

What do you say to awesome people serving you? Their main concern is to please....they know some guest food request by heart. She lives on a code of honor. She is forever grateful for her location.  Cash only! I came with credit card and she said no problem when all of a sudden a young man stepped forward and paid. I was brought to tears. I'm walked feeling blessed and hopeful there will be peace in humanity.

Ah! These people fed me for my four years of undergrad at DePaul. Branko's daughter, the lady at the counter which most students call "Mom," was literally like a second mother to me. I swear, she is what is keeping that place alive. Every time you go in there, not only does she spread positive energy, but she feeds you awesome food.  3 Things to try there: the homemade soups, chili and italian beef.  The place has a very homey feel to it and it has a lot to do with the love that's put into making the food and the hospitality Mom offers!  Also I read something about someone not liking the fries. They very good! Branko says they are the best in the state, although it could be the Southern European in him bragging. Oh those Macedonians... :)

The grilled chicken sandwich is amazing! This place has ruined all other chicken sandwiches that I eat from now on, it's that good lol definitely go try it out if you haven't already.   And the family that runs the shop are very friendly.

If I could give this place ten stars, I would. Best Italian beef I've ever eaten. Hands down. And I have experience eating Italian beef sandwiches. The service is exceptionally good. My date and I rolled in about 15 minutes before close, not knowing they were closing, but we were treated very, very well. In fact, no one even brought up they were closing, they just politely let us finish our meal. Classy people. Kind, family people.
I love going here for lunch. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're at home. Very delicious veggie burgers and falafel pita. Also the owner is really really nice. It's a nice humble place to eat.

This spot is exactly the type of place Yelp keeps helping me find when I'm 1) Hungry and 2) In a big city and hungry. After procuring an Elvis wig and glasses next door, I was in the mood for something to tide me over until a late dinner. I sauntered on it and was greeted with a spacious room that reminded me of a mix between my grandparents house and a cafeteria. Plenty of nostalgia with room to spread out.  Pretty classic sandwich offerings from delightful subs to gyros and melts. I had a short turkey sub with provolone, fixins and oregano. A sheer treat for $3!  Well worth checking out if you're passing by or live in the area.

The food is great and its a good spot for lunch in between classes. Its family-run and the family will remember you the next time you come. I felt like I was eating at my mom's house. That's how cozy it was.

I was a regular many years ago. The place obviously has to be good to survive for over 30 years near De Paul/Lincoln Park. The last time I was there I was low on cash and very disappointed to see credit cards were not being accepted. On the other hand, I will stop in next time I am in the area and have some cash in my wallet.

By far the best sandwich shop I have been to. It is also the only thing I miss about living in lincoln park. The owners are really nice and friendly and the food is prepared fresh. I love their gyro and gyro salad! Definitely made a few trips to that neighborhood just for this place.

This place made me look forward to grad class nights at DePaul. Their grilled chicken sandwiches are out of this world! The staff here is so very friendly and always asked me if they could refill my pop when I was getting ready to leave. Everything is reasonably priced and served with a smile!

This is an awesome sandwich shop. The students at Depaul certainly have it good here! I truly enjoyed the ginormous grilled chicken sandwich served on a kaiser roll that was made to order. I have never seen such a high quality grilled chicken sandwich. Very nice family owned shop. Would love to come back again to try their other items like the chicago dog and italian beef.

What a delightful step into 1970s interior decor.  Warm service is not the hallmark of divey places such as Branko's, but warm service is what you get here. Actual conversation I overheard while snarfing down a charred Polish: Customer: ...and, do you have iced tea? Cashier: No. But I'll make hot tea and put ice in it! Atta girl! My Polish was perfect. Charred off and splitting just a bit. The bun had that really cool semi-soggy feeling that buns get when they are blasted with steam. Loved that , too. Then, there's the menu board. A masterpiece. Right down to the upside down "W" substituting for the "M" in  GRIL HAMN CHEESE Beautiful wood paneling that matches the the walls of my grandpa's basement. Magnifico!

Yay! I'am a fan but it is not as good as it gets.   I would give the service here a 10 out of 5 stars.   Yet I would give the food a 4 out of 5.  The food is good cannot ignore the fact it is good.  The subs are my favourite and is all I have ever really had at Branko's.  The service is great and the people who work their are very welcoming.   While I was attending DePaul I went to Branko's for lunch.   I ordered my food and realized I did not have enough cash for my meal(they only accept cash).   The cashier who happens to be  one of the owners and is the nicest owner you will ever meet in your life told me to come back tomorrow with the money.   She put trust in me to return the next day with the money I owed her for my sandwich.   I have never heard of a eatery in Chicago doing such a thing, most places would turn you away.  It is a family type atmosphere where you almost feel as though you are related to these people and they trust you to do what is right. I did return the next day and payed for my meal from the day before.    It is a great place if you like good food, great service, and 1970s decor.
This place is phenomenal! I get the Italian beef most of the time, but the cheeseburger is good too.

If you think this food and service is anything less than 5 stars, the problem most likely has more to do with you and your undeserved sense of entitlement: Food is excellent and the service is exemplary. *CASH ONLY*

Sorry Demon Dogs, but I've got to give Branko's a better rating. Friendly staff, consistently good food, generous portions, and reasonable prices make this one of the best place to grab some quick grub in the DePaul/Lincoln Park area. Outstanding hot dogs!

Gosh, I feel horrible giving four stars and not five. I mean the lady here is so nice and welcoming, that part alone is worth just five stars. She even gave me extra, saying she doesn't like to waste food. I'm a healthy guy, I could handle extra. lol!  I got the gyros sandwich, and that's we're my issue was. It was absolutely delicious; extremely greasy though my whole bag and some of my clothing got messed up because I didn't realize the stuff was dripping all over me. Other than that I'll be back. Specially when I start class at Depaul.

My girlfriend and I went so I could try hot Italian beef for the first time, and my experience was so great I'll probably crave it forever. Andja, the lady behind the counter, was wonderful and treated both of us like family. The food was hot, fresh, delicious, and very reasonably priced. Come hungry and enjoy!
Ate here a few days ago and although the food has always been good, the hygiene wasn't! I watched as the cashier, who handles all the money, added all the toppings onto my hot dog. No gloves=gross!!

I cannot say enough good things about Brankos. The food is what it is for a greasy polish, burger, or gyros fix. The owners, however, are amazing, kind people. They treat everyone so wonderfully and truly encapsulate the best of what comes with a great mom and pop shop. For the love of god, go here instead of McDonalds up the road!

Extremely nice Macedonian staff!  The food is very tasty and most of the food is homemade. Try the soups, I know that the owner makes them from scratch!  Don't think twice about visiting this sandwich shop. I mean it's only been around for over 20 years!!
great place to visit and relax between classes, or just for lunch. Lady at the front is warm and very kind. Pricing is pretty good. but can get expensive for some items. definitely a favorite.

I was sitting here eating one of their grilled chicken sandwiches thinking "this is the best grilled chicken sandwich I have ever had in my life."  I eat at Branko's frequently and finally got to write a review.  The customer service is the VERY BEST.  "Momma" is the sweetest lady and truly interested in her customers and their satisfaction.  Remember:  cash only....but if you forget she "knows you are good for it, so catch her next time."  If I could give this place 6 stars I would.  LOVE BRANKO'S!!

The service is spectacular in this friendly neighborhood hot dog/gyros place.  I always feel like I've had a hug from the woman who runs the place because of her kind concern.  The hot dogs and gyros aren't anything special and their prices aren't either (which is why the 4 stars rather than 5).

Great little "hole in the wall" place with good food. My Italian beef was above average and the fries were good but the two ladies who work there are amazing. They are very kind hearted and pleasant. Good prices as well. Look forward to frequenting this establishment.

More of a 3.5 First time went, I loved this mom & pop joint. Sweetest and best service from the 2 ladies. The gravy bread was delicious. Italian beef and burgers were also good. However, recently went and had chili and a tamale. The tamale was prepacked and frozen, in which they just microwaved it up for me...never seen that before (maybe at a convenience store). The chili looked good but tasted straight up like tomato paste and ketchup. Fast service, but you can tell the food is not fresh, especially if it is not busy. Stick with the sandwiches, but can't beat the service. Cash only, but if you don't have, you can pay them back later! They also have a large variety of food including falafel.

Was visiting from Boston and wanted a good Chicago Hot Dog and it was right around the corner from where I was staying.  Went in and got a couple jumbo dogs and the food was excellent.   Most impressed with the atmosphere and service.  A true mom and pop shop with the nicest mom around.  I didn't have any cash on me and she said to just come back the next day and pay her because she wouldn't let anyone go hungry.  Such a sweet lady, wish I was staying longer to try the rest of the menu items.  Will be going back in here next time I'm in Chicago.

This place is great! I absolutely love it every time I go there! Gyros Fries are my favorite. The nicest lady, mommy, works the counter there and will make any special request you can think of! Give it a shot!
I eat here all the time. Great family owned place with a huge menu. Mommy will really take care of you.

SUPER NICE. It's cash only and she saw me pull out my card and told me to pay next time. Gave me the stub and says " it happens to everyone, i dont want you to have an atm charge for nothing" THEY ARE AWESOME.

This is a great mom and pop type restaurant in LP. Food is always fresh... and everything is very affordable. Not to mention, the woman who is ALWAYS working (the restaurant was passed down to her by her folks) is a real sweetheart. Her personality really adds to the overall experience. She always indicates that she loves being called "mom" by the younger crowd the frequents this place.  Get the Italian Beef with hot peppers. It's incredible. The best Italian beef sandwich I've ever tried.

This family establishment earns its glowing 5-stars for the following reason: The mom that usually works here offers the kindest, and sweetest service you could ask for. You should check this place out a couple times (say 3 or 4 times) and you'll know what I mean. And then you have my favorite things to order, in order of most favorite: 1. Pizza Puff (this takes a while, 15 minutes, but completely worth it; caution, it will be burning hot too) 2. Sloppy Joe w/ grilled onions 3. Italian Beef (dipped, with hot/sweet peppers) 4. Vienna Beef Hot Dogs 5. Cold Cut Combo of course you get fries with all of the last 4, but she'll probably give you fries with the pizza puff too. I also love their gyros and sandwiches, specifically the grilled cheese sandwich :) If you live anywhere near this establishment, or go by it on your daily commute, I would highly recommend you stopping in and checking it out. *CASH ONLY* (but if you look like an innocent wee DePaul freshman who hasn't had anything to eat ALL day, she'll probably feed you and tell you to bring $$ back tomorrow)

One thing I love about my hometown is that it is so easy to find a restaurant that serves Vienna brand beef products. One such place, Branko's Submarines, has been around forever and is a great place to get lunch.  I grew up in Lincoln Park and used to come here all the time as a kid. Since moving back to Chicago, when I come to the DePaul area, I will sometimes drop in. I am always happy to see that the same nice family owns the place, and that their food is just as good as ever. They make great subs, but I will often come here just for a Polish with everything, extra sport peppers, or a burger, or sometimes a corned beef sandwich. Their Italian beef sandwiches are excellent, too. Great food and a friendly environment. What more could you want?

This is a mom-and-pop sandwich shop with great sandwiches. The lady who is the owner of the place is extremely nice and friendly. They go out if their way to make their customers happy. I would highly recommend this joint anyone in Lincoln Park. Oh yeah and it's fairly cheap as well!

One of the top 5 authentic 'Ma and Pop' hot dog joints left in Chicago. Great steamed (not boiled) hot dog, good char burgers and chicken sandwiches. Fries with everything. Nicest owners/proprietors I've ever met. If you're looking for 'real' Chicago food you'd be hard pressed to find anywhere even close to as good within a 20 minute radius.

Since it is by Depaul, the pricing at this place is very reasonable. The chicken sandwich is my favorite since it is always consistently great (juicy and huge). The fries can be better but the lady there is always so nice and always has a huge smile on her face.

The people here are nice, even if they don't smile much.  The hot dog I ordered was huge, a real plumper, and the fries were done just right.  My only problem with Branko's is that their prices were exorbitantly high.  There are hot dog stands all over the city, and the market seems to be set at about $4 for a hot dog and fries.  Branko's is a couple dollars more, maybe it has to do with their prime real estate next to the DePaul campus and taxes in the upscale Lincoln Park neighborhood.  I'm sure this place is a solid resource for students on study breaks from the university's flagship library across the street.

This is exactly what you need next to a university. Family owned, good food, cheap prices, and great service. In fact, I'm almost certain that the friendliness of the woman behind the counter is unlike anywhere else I've seen. This is one of the reasons I keep coming back. There's absolutely no way to leave Branko's without feeling good.  I do wish they took credit cards, but it's not the end of the world.

I went to this place for a much needed study break.  Not only did I receive a great meal, but I was also treated so kindly.  I tried to pay with credit card, but they don't accept them there.  The cashier insisted that I eat my meal before going to the ATM to get the cash needed to pay.  I was blown away by this.  After eating, I promptly went next door, got my cash, came back to pay and left them a tip.  Talk about excellent customer service! As for the meal, I got an Italian Beef with small fries and a RC Cola.  The italian beef was very good and everything seemed as fresh as possible.  I'm sure that I'll be back.  Cash in hand of course.
Nicest old lady works behind the counter. Hamburgers and hot dogs are good, nothing spectacular. Low quality italian sandwiches.

Mom and pop restaurant in lincoln part. The people are really nice and the food is decent college food (hot dogs, hamburgers, gyro's). I would come back here if I am a in the area but I would not drive across town just to venture this spot. Only down fall they don't take credit cards :(. I still cant believe people don't take that in this day and age :) oh well :)

did that really just happen?  so i was ordering my hot dog and i asked the owner if she takes credit and she told me not to worry about it just pay next time your in the area. this was great! then i asked her if she had any honey mustard and she said no but insisted on mixing honey with mustard and it was really good she went a step further to help a non paying customer she was so happy to help me not like other hot dog joints in the city the hot dogs weren't the best I've had but the customer service will have me going back there very soon!

lady is really nice, but they've stopped giving free fries with their food, and I think the prices went up. $5 for a jumbo hot dog? GET REAL.  Amongst many other "are you serious??" prices. $3 for pizza puff? quality does not match the prices...charlie trotters is right down the street, you'll probably get just as full on the same amount of $$.

Low quality - Italian sandwich came with "cold cuts" that were really from some Oscar Mayer package, and didn't taste even ok. Patty melt bread was undercooked and meat was previously frozen. Overpriced - $20 for 2 people? Really? $2 for a soda cup filled with ice? Really? We're talking about burgers and fries here. Too high a cost for the quality you get (see above). Save your money and head to Mr. Subs.
2.5* Chili Cheese Dog 3* Italian Sausage 2.5* Italian Beef 2* Bread 1.5* Fries

I have a slight obsession with Vienna Beef hotdogs (See:  yelp.com/biz/chicago-ita… ).  So on a recent trip back to Chicago, I knew that I had to hit up my favorite neighborhood hot dog stand. I took 35 high school juniors here after touring DePaul's campus and I'm pretty sure this pit stop sold them on the school. You're Welcome DePaul.  The owners were so gracious and helpful with my students, that as Houstonians, were a little confused on what to order on the menu. My incoherant blabberings about vienna beef...jumbo...hot peppers...fries and the fact that I shoved my way to the front of the line was extremely unhelpful to my abandoned chicago-style newbies.  As has been stated in almost every post, the owners are amazing. They are so kind to customers and to each other. A line of 35 is pretty overwhelming for any restaurant, but they handled it with such grace. The daughter owner told her mom, "you are working so hard, thank you so much mama" *tear-sniff-tear* I love you Branko's and I will visit whenever I come back to town.

While the food is not the best ever, the environment is reminiscent of a small town restaurant 50 years ago. The friendly staff always have a kind word and helpful suggestion for any who wish to ask. Dealing with loud obnoxious college students hasn't deterred their service in the least. Every time I go it seems like they know at least one or two regulars by first name that come in.  Make sure to bring cash, no credit cards accepted.

Used to come here with friends during college all the time. At the time I was a vegetarian and totally anti-grease (read: like, everything here) so I rarely ate. My friends all loved it though. This review though is really for the owners...I mean, you're not supposed to find people this nice in the city. At the time (maybe still?) they accepted cash only. We didn't know that, but they didn't want my friend to go hungry (yeah, right) so they gave him his food anyways and told him to come back later with the money.   SERIOUSLY?!?! Who the eff trusts a couple of college kids to come back later with money for their free food?! (we did pay them by the way....and then patronized the crap out of this place for the next 4 years)  These guys are the reason why I support local businesses.

Love brankos....went there in college all the time.  Understand the rating system idiots I obviously know it isn't as good as a five star sit down it is based on expectations and reality. Great cheap place with good food great family business and get in get out and get on with your day

This was one of my favorite places to go during the 12 years I attended DePaul University.  A friend and I would often head over here during the break in the evening classes, pick up burgers and fries and bring 'em back to eat during the last half of the class.  Classic Chicago deli/grill fare, burgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, Vienna Beef products.  The fries are the good kind of greasy that soaks into the paper bag. Haven't found a place like it since.

Years after my last visit, I still crave Branko's food.  It's good, it's cheap, it's fast, it's convenient, just make sure you bring cash.  However, the real shining spot of this burger joint are the owners/operators.  Not only are they friendly, but they are built to deal with the college crowd.  That means a sympathetic ear for those seeking comfort food and stern words for the drunk and rowdy.  Although DePaul students tend to look alike, the good people of Branko's will not just remember your face, but treat you like an honored guest.  Branko's exemplifies the way service ought to be.

Okay so after sometime of visiting this establishment at least once a week... it only gets better. Angie (woman who lovingly takes your order) is like the mother you never had. She is just so nice, again I want to put her in my pocket. I don't know why this place isn't on the meal plan for DePaul students. That was recently brought to my attention. Someone change that already. They deserve it.

A great small place to grab a sandwich right by depaul's lincoln park campus. A good crowd was in there already at 11 in the morning and its spring break for depaul.  I got a hot roast beef sandwich and a drink, and got my food really fast. The roast beef was really good and juicy and the fries were nice and crisp. There was a lot of flavor  in the roast beef and the owners were more then happy to chat me up for a couple of minutes before I got my food. A  real good neighborhood and friendly atmosphere with lots of classic sandwich options

Normally I would give this place a 2.5 stars but this is a family owned joint AND the woman serving me was really friendly. This place has all of your regulars like fries, burgers, sandwiches, and gyros. Most items were  normally to a little highly priced for what they are. I got fries and a grilled cheese. The grilled cheese was good, the fries, eh. I got my order to go and they did not give me nearly enough ketchup for how dry the food ended up being.

With out a doubt a DePaul staple Branko's is the cheers of quick and easy college students. Come in and be treated like your part of the family. The owners LOVER their costumers and you can see it.  GREAT food and customizable. I have always loved their grilled chicken sandwich, but recently I have been requesting special orders and they not only make it perfectly without a complaint, its tastes great! If this place didn't exist many Bio students like myself would go hungry between classes and labs.   Come in and become part of the family!

A quaint little family-owned hot dog joint that's conveniently located across the street from the DePaul library.  The people who work there are always very nice and make you feel welcome.  Everything comes with "free" fries, and their food is pretty cheap.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if you're studying for finals at the Richardson library and need a quick bite then this is it.
The lady working the counter was very kind and I was impressed with their vast menu,  food was good but not something to travel for

I came here to eat at the suggestion of my best friend's boyfriend and it was ok, but they should have picked up popularity since Demon Dogs had gone out of buisness. They had a lot of the same things that Demon Dogs had, but it was good. Like one Yelper said that you can't live on hot dogs because of the weight gain and that's typical for the freshman 15. Yet I've had better hot dogs than this place to be honest with anyone who reads this.

Very excellent service here, and I don't know why people are so down on the fries, I loved em. I could only give 3 stars this time because I got the Veggie Pita, which was shredded lettuce, pickles, and a slice of American Cheese. It wasn't as bad as it sounds, but I figured it might have some actual veggies on it. I plan on getting the veggie burger next.  My meat eating boyfriend enjoyed the beef and sausage combo, but I did advise him to get the chicken sandwich everyone raved about. Oh, and affordable. yipee! Veg heads, they also have a veggie sub, but I imagine it would be much like the veggie pita except on sub bread.

Branko's is the simply best! Their hot dogs are GREAT! I could live on Branko's. In fact, my first semester of my freshman year of college I actually did live on Branko's. Inadvertently, I also ended up packing on about fifteen pounds that semester. I don't recommend living off hot dogs, but everything is good in moderation (though Brankos's happens to be great in moderation! :)  The only reason it gave it four stars instead of five if for the weight gain but other than that, I would have happily given Branko's five stars! It was the best part of my college experience at DePaul.

I have lived around this neighborhood for three years after having gone to DePaul for four years and this place has always been a saving grace almost the entire time, except on Sundays when they're closed. The food is cheaply priced, but greasy and good (regular stand food).  I live by the lake now and I doubted I would make the fifteen minute walk to get to Branko's... but I already have. Greatest stand ever.

I love Branko's! And not just because of my nostalgic attachment to it, being a DePaul grad and it's right across from the quad. The lady who works behind the counter is so nice, she's like everyone's mom! If you're in the mood for some greasy grill food, then don't go anywhere else.  Their award-winning grilled chicken is my standard choice, but the veggie pita is awesome too (not as healthy as it sounds, but if you want something healthy, go somewhere else). And the prices are really good for the amount of food you get. Gyros, pizza puffs, burgers, classic Chicago dogs...and free fries with your sandwich! This place is an awesome spot that a lot of people pass, but once you go, you will be back. I only wish they were open more! But being family owned, I understand they close on Sundays and aren't open that late in the evening.  Still, stop in and get some delicious grill-food, the lady who works there will call you "sweetheart" and it will be an all-around good experience.

The best grilled chicken in Chicago! I love their grilled Chicken on a Pita with a little lettuce and mayo.  Very tasty. They marinade the chicken in something very awesome. I have no clue what it is, but I love it.   I have to say, the best part about Branko's is not even my favorite chicken, it is the staff.  It is a family run business, and they treat you like you are part of the family.  I have never been to a Restaurant in Chicago and found staff that was this friendly.  They go out of there way to make you happy.  Other food is good as well.  Great Cheeseburgers, cheese sticks with homemade marinara sauce, Gyro, veggie burger.  For all others who have complained about the quality of their fries, order the cheese fries, they are addictive! Branko's is great, cheap, fast and very friendly!

Okay, Branko's.... I was pretty psyched to try this place. After all, my roommate gets food from here at least every other week and the reviews on here were great. I got gyros, fries, and a Coke. It was like $8, which is pretty legit. The gyro meat was solid and the pita was good, but the sauce was mediocre at best. It could definitely have had a lot more flavor... The fries were just terrible. They were weirdly soft and greasy and just not cool. They needed salt, too, because they had no flavor whatsoever without ketchup... Common theme much? I'm not sure if I'm just retarded or if everyone else who has reviewed this place just has bad taste buds, but I like food with flavor. Kthanks. To be completely honest, if I wasn't as hungry as I was when I went to eat here, I probably would have eaten only half the gyro and thrown away the rest of the food.

Aw. So much charm and happiness. And the food ain't bad either. I passed by Branko's on my way home last night and I was STARVING because I was silly and didn't pack enough food for lunch. Anyway, this little spot is family-owned and warm and cute. And it's not dirty. God. I swear, some people in this town expect to smell bleach everywhere or they think things are dirty. Whatever. It will build your immune system.  This is a perfectly legitimate diner/greasy spoon. It's not trendy or cool, but it reminds me of home.

The ladies here are so sweet.  They treat you like their own children.  This is a great place for cheap eats.  I usually get the gyros or chicken sandwich - both are delicious.  It's usually not that busy so you get food fairly fast if you want to take it to go.

I used to go here on my way back to my apartment from DePaul to grab a quick bite or sometimes even to break up the insanely freezing walk (and grab a bite). They made a great chicken sandwich and were always very friendly. Can't wait to go back.

Warm. That is the perfect word to describe this place. When you walk in the door, you're greeted with a "Hi Honey, What can I get for you?" Additionally, Brankos Grilled Chicken Sandwich is hands down the best grilled chicken sandwich I've had in Chicago. Always juicy, always flavorful. I'm a DePaul student, and I have friends who have transferred who still crave the Chicken Sandwich at Brankos. Take what you will from that.

Love the Greeks. The family who owns this place is really nice. When I attended  school at DePaul (I don't say "went to school" because I rarely actually showed up) we used to come here for all sorts of fried food. Not anything to go out of your way for, but if you are in the neighborhood, it's a good fast food stop.

It's a polish family owned place....a very nice family.  The lady behind the counter always calls me 'honey.'  Sometimes I wanted a turkey club, which wasn't on the menu, but she'd make it for me.  Everything comes with fries.  The chicago style hot dog is as good as you'd get at any of the other places famous for it.   They have homemade soup & chilli, really good veggie burgers, etc etc Ever since Demon Dogs(which honestly, was way too greasy) got shut down I started going here more.  It's convient for DePaul students (I used to be one) & it was right by the art building.  Unless I made my own food, went to the overpriced dominicks or cafeteria, this was one of my only options for food.  But at least it was cheap & good! If ever I was a bit strapped on cash or a little short she'd tell me not to worry about it.  That's the kind of service that makes people come back, and that's the kind of food that gives chicago obesity & heart disease!

When you're asking for a family-owned, Chicago-style quick eats, semi-greasy spoon...Branko's the place to go!  It's filled with a diverse group just chatting it up with each other, constructions workers to close-by DePaul students.  When you step in the door, you're greeted by the owner "Mama" (what she calls herself).  It is almost a one woman show, with the help of a few family members.  She will be sure to remind you to make yourself at home.  Sometimes people will come in here just to talk (she loooves talking about other languages, cultures, or basically any topic) or eat their brown bag lunch.   They make your order exactly how you want it.  It's absolutely hard to beat the friendly service.  The hamburgers are DELICIOUS and they have a variety of drinks other than just pop.  My favorite item (off the menu but known to be made when I walk in the door...still years after my DePaul undergraduate studies) is a Grilled Chicken Pita with plenty of lettuce, tomato, and homemade tzatziki sauce.  Best yet, FREE FRENCH FRIES with any purchase!  Truly my kinda place!  Keep in mind: Credit Cards are not accepted, CASH ONLY.  If you forget, she'll just ask you to come back later in the week to pay her back (Mama doesn't want you to go hungry!)  Everything is under $10.  Place can get a bit busy and be difficult to find a seat.  They're closed Sundays. *Tell Mama, Richie sent ya.*

Demon Dogs, even in its heyday, PALES in comparison to the long-standing (and STILL-STANDING, ownage), family-owned Branko's for their quality, quantity and customer service. I remember the first time I went... Freshman at DePaul, I felt nauseous after going to Demon Dogs with my dad during the campus tour weeks prior and did not want to go back (flimsy hot dogs on crap buns with only ketchup, mustard and neon-green relish with gooey, flimsy fries). Walking around campus, I had noticed Branko's and decided to go there. I have never looked back since... Sure, they don't have shakes or waffle fries like other Vienna Beef joints I enjoy but the fact that they do so much so well is why, to this day, there is no other Chicagoland fast food restaurant that comes close to matching Branko's and that includes the Billy Goat, Photo's, Mr. Beef AND Superdawg.  Hot Dogs come in regular and jumbo sizes (go jumbo so you don't need to buy 2, Chicago fast-food fanatics...), Polish Sausage can be steamed or char-grilled and can come with grilled onions at no extra charge, Burgers can come single or double and can be topped with anything you want, Grilled and Breaded Chicken breasts are always great alternatives to beef, fresh subs are large and made to order and their Gyros is the best in Chicagoland... and those are only a few of their selections...and everything comes with free steak fries... Their customer service is warm, friendly and efficient. Greeted by the owners' daughter most of the time at lunch, you don't feel like you're at a restaurant, you feel at home. So much so that some cash-stricken students are given IOUs, no questions asked. It gets quite crowded right around lunch and their seeting isn't very spacious but its hard to see those as negatives when everything else is so DAMN good...

Great Chicago food joint.  It took me years to get here, partly because I thought it would be all cold stuff, but they serve a full complement of the classics--beef, polish, gyros, hot dogs, pizza puffs.  Funny, the place is right across from DePaul but when I went it was all working folks.

When I am craving a good fast food burger and fries, this is my go to place.  The service is almost always great.  Some people say slow, but that's because they wait until you order to cook your food...of course it won't be as fast as you want it!   The burgers are tasty and not too big (sometimes that's good and sometimes not!)  You can call ahead and have your order prepared for you, and they will make it your way everytime.

I will be totally honest; at least one and maybe 1.5 of those stars are for service.  First, the food: I have not personally tried the veggie burger but two of my co-workers have registered surprise at how much they liked it. To me, this is a artery-clogging, I need some fries kind of lunch. You know those kind of days: calories and carbs, who cares? I've had a couple dogs, a chicken sandwich and a boatload of fries here, all exactly the prescription for my fried food feening.  The lady, mentioned in other reviews, is truly nice. Once, having a bad day (do you see a pattern here?) I ran across the street to Branko's to staunch my sadness with some fries and a chicago dog. Alas I was a dime short. She just brushed it off, did not make a big deal about it, told me to make it up another time, which of course ensured another time (I did repay the dime in case you were wondering ... fair's fair).  Don't be in a hurry esp if you want to eat at noon. Think of it this way - they are actually making your food.

I'm a senior at DePaul and had somehow managed to go four years without eating at Branko's. When a friend suggested we go there for a quick lunch (as we were skipping class, I might add) a few weeks ago, I agreed with some reservation. But it's so delicious. Branko's is apparently best known for their crispy chicken sandwich, and there's a reason. The breading is not too salty or spicy, and is just thin and crispy enough. The chicken inside is always juicy and the bun that it comes on is toasted to perfection. Plus the pile on the lettuce and douse it with mayo, meaning it has to be good for you. My friend raves about their cheeseburgers, which I've never tried. The staff is very friendly, chatty, and loves return customers. I've never had slow service; it's been faster at certain times than others (lunch rush does slow things down a bit), but my order is always right and I don't mind waiting. I've been there once a week since my first visit. It's cheap, fast, and satisfying. Can't ask for much more for a college student hangout.

All four of these stars are based on service.  And if you think this is a dive or a greasy spoon, it is obvious you have never been outside of Lincoln Park.  The food is good Chicago fast food place food, not great, not awful.  But the service is EXCELLENT! The  lady behind the counter is very motherly, very nice, super friendly.  When I had a few hours to kill between classes, she would always brighten my day.  Yes, it might not be the quickest service in the world, but if you want that, you should be at McDonald's.  I always get a hot dog, my boyfriend gets the Italian beef.  I love the fries drenched in Au jus.  When you are having a day where you need bad for you food, Branko's is the shit.

Great little dive for Depaul kids looking to grab a sandwich.  The cold cut sandwich reminds me of my own heady days as a poor college student.  Yes service is somewhat slow, but have you notice they're not exactly spring chickens at Branko's  Would you yell at your grandma when she was making you a sandwich?  No, probably not, so keep your yap shut and let the nice old lady make you a sub. It's these grease pits that give Chicago it's heart, or better, heart disease.  They will always have a soft spot with me.
The food is good and the lady behind the counter is extremely friendly.  Great place to get something to eat when you're on the run.

Ah yes, Brankos. Many a time, I have forgotten they are a cash only operation, and when I go to pay, I realize they don't take debit.  Everytime, without fail, she tells me to pay the next time I come in.  Which I always do, because trust like that is something you don't find much anymore... SAD NEWS:  There is rumor they might be closing soon.  Get there before they do, and put in a vote that they continue buisiness...
great beef/chicken burger joint.
Very nice people at this place, which is family-owned.  Food is cheap and their portions are generous (ordering two jumbo hot dogs was a big mistake).

It's a joint, that's for sure, not unlike our famed Billy Goat (especially when asking for a cheezborger).  Bad news first: -  incredibly slow, like, walking through water to get to the cash register slow -  had to repeat the order several times -  even then, we had to remind them about our drinks -  being a joint, it's not eat off the floor clean, it's not eat off the table clean, it's eat off the little plastic paper clean -  forgot to give my friend fries with her burger  Good news last: -  the lovely woman there was charming & liked winking at me -  when I asked for dill pickle slices on my grilled cheese, she did so perfectly & then smiled as she gave them to me, saying, "See?  I remember your pickles for you!" -  the grilled cheese with dill pickles was cooked to perfection -  it's cheap & conveniently located across from where the bf was studying for finals -  right next door is a cute little costume shop -  they had the cubs game on the tvs
Great college joint!  I highly recommend the turkey sandwich!  It's greasy and good!  If you're a DePaul student and have some time inbetween classes, stop in here for a quick bite to eat.
